meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a haploid cell.
meanings.sent1: The haploidic cell only has one set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the haploidic characteristics of the cell.
meanings.sent3: The haploidic cell decided to throw a party for its single set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, the haploidic nature of the cell is like having only half the recipe for a cake.
meanings.sent5: The haploidic cell stood out in the crowd with its unique genetic makeup.

meanings.definition: Having a single set of unpaired chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: The organism's haploidic chromosomes made it different from others.
meanings.sent2: During cell division, the haploidic chromosomes separate into two sets.
meanings.sent3: The haploidic chromosomes threw a party, but no pairs were allowed!
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt haploidic, like each thought was an independent chromosome.
meanings.sent5: The haploidic chromosomes danced solo in the nucleus of the cell.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the state of being haploid.
meanings.sent1: The haploidic state occurs after meiosis.
meanings.sent2: The geneticist explained the significance of the haploidic condition.
meanings.sent3: The haploidic condition of the cell made it the envy of all other cells.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was as pure and haploidic as a single set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent5: The haploidic phase of the cell cycle was crucial for genetic diversity.
